instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-3115: What is 820-3115? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.PPBUS_G3H: What is PPBUS_G3H? Main system power rail that charges the battery, or is power from the battery, that everything else is powered from. .
definitions.3V3_S5: What is 3V3_S5? 3V3_S5 and PP3V3_S5 are interchangeable, see definition for PP3V3_S5. .
definitions.PM_BATLOW_L: What is PM_BATLOW_L? PM_BATLOW_L is a signal that tells the system the battery is too low for it to turn on & keeps it from turning on, when it is low. _L means the signal is asserted when its voltage is low. .
definitions.PP3V3_S5: What is PP3V3_S5? PP3V3_S5 is a 3.3v power rail when the system is in an S5 soft off power state.
definitions.PP3V3_SUS: What is PP3V3_SUS? The "PP3V3_SUS" rail on a MacBook logic board is a power rail that provides a 3.3-volt supply to the suspend-to-RAM (S3 state) components. .
definitions.SMC_PM_G2_EN: What is SMC_PM_G2_EN? SMC_PM_G2_EN is a signal that comes from the SMC that is a prerequsite for all of the enable signals for the S5 rails to come on, such as P3V3S5_EN. S5 rails will not come on if SMC_PM_G2_EN is not coming..
definitions.U7201: What is U7201? U7201 is responsible for the 3.3v and 5v power rails on many devices..

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> problems
threads.message:
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-B with no fan spin. green light on charger.

<SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> is 12.52v

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> problems
threads.message:
First of all, welcome to the forum!

You need to post some more information.
Do you get <SIGNAL>3V3_S5</SIGNAL>/SUS?
Whay about <SIGNAL>PM_BATLOW_L</SIGNAL>?
Are you using 60/85W original charger?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> problems
threads.message:
Thank you! I am using the 60w this is a 13" board.

<SIGNAL>PP3V3_S3</SIGNAL> not present
<SIGNAL>PP3V3_SUS</SIGNAL> not present
<SIGNAL>PP3V3_S5</SIGNAL> not present
<SIGNAL>PM_BATLOW_L</SIGNAL> not present

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> problems
threads.message:
PCH cannot start power on sequence without <SIGNAL>PM_BATLOW_L</SIGNAL>.
Check <SIGNAL>SMC_PM_G2_EN</SIGNAL>.

threads.message:
You've said <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> is good.
Check why doesn't arrive to <CHIP>U7201</CHIP>...
